page.title: 01The Plain west of Audlem
page.content: Imagine a backdrop of green with generous splashes of black and white. This picture typifies this dairying area, with its lush green grass, carrying black and white fresian herds shaded by stately oaks in the headrows. There are eighteen farmhouses, with ubiquitous damson trees and once tied cottages, many now renovated and occupied by by commuters to nearby towns.Limousin, Simmental, Charolais and Hereford beef cattle can be se en, as well as sheep. Cereals roots hay and silage are grown for animal feed. At Burleydam nurseries, beautiful chrysanthemums are grown for the Manchester market. A wood turner at Lightwood Green employs ten workers making chair legs spindles pestle handles, hayrakes and items.
